content: on by CSMSERVE and logged off shortly afterward. During that time, VMCSM commands were run on the candidate system to create VMCSM structures and control files. After the command completed, we logged on to MAINT720 on the managed system and reviewed the console files in the reader to observe the VMCSM activity. The output of the SERVMGR SYStem ADD command in Example 9-18 shows that the command ended with a warning. SERVMGR reminds us that the RSU1 service level that we assigned the system to was delivered to the system. After RDBKZVMC was added as a managed system, we issued some query commands to check the status. First, we used SERVMGR SYSTEM QUERY to check the status of the systems. Note: We found another configuration requirement that at the time of this writing was not documented in z/VM 7.2 Service Guide, GC24-6325. We found that the SERVMGR SYSTEM ADD command timed out without completing because the MAINT720 ID was attempting to issue a command to the CSMSERVE ID by using SMSG
